title: Coordinator, Post Production - Live Action (Japan)
overview: The Coordinator, Post Production - Live Action (Japan) position entails managing both internal and third party co-productions in Japan, overseeing the post production processes from pre-production to launch, coordinating with cross functional teams, and maintaining post schedules, vendors, and creative approval sessions.
description:
We are seeking an experienced Post Production Coordinator based in Japan to help manage both internal and third party co-productions from a post perspective with both scripted and unscripted series. This person will manage the titles from the beginning until the launch supporting Post Production Managers in each phase of the post production processes such as pre-production, principle photography, editorial, picture and sound finishing, including consolidating deliverables.Â 
Â 
Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of production with our Japan Content team.
Â 
The Role
A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, assertive, diplomatic in communication, quick-thinking, flexible and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times while working closely with the cross functional teams.
Â 
This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative. The role will be focused on supporting Japanese live-action contents that are shot and finished throughout Japan.Â  Basic knowledge and understanding of scripted and/or unscripted workflow required.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

extras.title: Post Scheduling:
content: Proactively lead production partners toward efficient execution of the required post production schedule and workflows
Track and manage all post schedules, keeping stakeholders apprised of the status
Communicate and align with internal cross functional teams for the launch preparation
Set up and manage dailies and cut viewing access for shows
Coordinate onboarding partners for the new projects
Update and manage internal database/trackers
Manage Publicity and Marketing requests and assets

extras.title: Staffing/Vendors:
content: Maintain and curate the preferred vendor list for dailies, motion graphics, and finishing
Research and maintain preferred post staff list

extras.title: Content Management:
content: Set up and attend key creative approval sessions such as final dub playbacks, VFX reviews, or color correction reviews
Schedule and attend Netflix screenings, previews, premieres, etc.

extras.title: Qualifications:
content: 3+ Years as a Post Production Supervisor or Manager working in scripted and/or unscripted content.
3+ years of experience within a medium to high budget studio, network or high volume production company
Ability to handle a fast-paced environment supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery)
Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K and HDR
Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters
Team-player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting
Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Movie Magic Budgeting, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail
Working knowledge of UHD/4K cameras, UHD/4K workflows, Avid, Final Cut Pro, Premiere, Resolve, Baselight, Nucoda, Pablo Rio, After Effects, ProTools, IMF, DCP
Professional working knowledge of English and Japanese languages
